H0.text: Spring is the season the Northern Hemisphere experiences when it is tilted away from the Sun.

H1.text: Summer is the season the Northern Hemisphere experiences when it is tilted away from the Sun.

H2.text: Autumn is the season the Northern Hemisphere experiences when it is tilted away from the Sun.

H3.text: Winter is the season the Northern Hemisphere experiences when it is tilted away from the Sun.

A4.text: When it is winter in the Northern Hemisphere, the Southern Hemisphere faces the Sun more directly and thus experiences warmer temperatures than the Northern Hemisphere.

A5.text: Winter is the coldest and darkest season of the year in temperate and polar climates. It occurs after autumn and before spring, when the hemisphere is oriented away from the Sun as a result of the tilt of Earth's axis.
